citeinfo.title: 2011 Subsidized Rental Housing in the Twin Cities

descript.abstract: This data, compiled from various sources such as MN Housing (MHFA), HUD, the USDA, the Federal Home Loan Bank of Des Moines, and various local government and nonprofit sources, details total units per Census Tract of publicly-funded rental housing affordable to 80% area median income (AMI) or below. Coverage is the seven county Twin Cities Metro area. Note: Housing Choice Vouchers (aka Section 8), a tenant-based subsidy that allows renters to use vouchers in the private market, is not included in this dataset.
descript.purpose: To study subsidized housing supply in the Twin Ctiies.

timeperd.current: Data is updated with respect to first finance close of properties/developments within the set.

citeinfo.title: Individual property information related to units in this data set is publicly available at http://www.housinglink.org/streams/

metainfo.metstdn: 2011 Subsidized Rental Housing in the Twin Cities

distinfo.resdesc: 2011 Subsidized Rental Housing in the Twin Cities

attr.attrdef: 11-Digit FIPS Code for 2010 US Census Tracts
Sum total of subsidized housing units in the tract

overview.eaover: The polygon shapefile consists of merely two variables: - GEOID10: (11 digit FIPS Code for 2010 US Census Tracts) - Sum_Units: Sum total of subsidized rental housing units in the tract.

dataqual.complete: All known subsidized units with a first finance close prior to Jan 1, 2012

attracc.attraccr: Aggregated point data is address-level accurate.

procstep.procdesc: Our organization reaches out to primary funders of affordable housing in MN. We then reach out to dozens of local organizations & agencies to see if any units were missed. After that, we address-match results and process point data to arrive at a sum total for Census Tracts.
